1.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
a mass of persons (or figuratively, things), especially reg. organized forwar (an army); by implication, a campaign, literally or figuratively (specifically, hardship, worship)
a man in general (singly or collectively)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
a man at wages  by the day or year
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

2.brief: to inhale eagerly; figuratively, to cover; by implication, to be angry; also to hasten
a man at wages  by the day or year
to bind together (perhaps by twisting), i.e. collect; (figuratively) to expect

3.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to inherit (as a (figurative) mode of descent), or (generally) to occupy; causatively, to bequeath, or (generally) distribute, instate
evil (as destructive), literally (ruin) or morally (especially guile); figuratively idolatry (as false, subjective), uselessness (as deceptive, objective; also adverbially, in vain)
properly, a twist (away of the light), i.e. night; figuratively, adversity
toil, i.e. wearing effort; hence, worry, wheth. of body or mind
properly, to weigh out; by implication, to allot or constitute officially; also to enumerate or enroll

4.brief: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
to rise (in various applications, literal, figurative, intensive and causative)
to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)
properly, tossed; abstractly, a rolling (on the bed)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
properly, a breeze, i.e. (by implication) dusk (when the evening breeze prevails)

5.brief: properly, wrap around, i.e. (by implication) to put on agarment or clothe (oneself, or another), literally or figuratively
flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman
a maggot (as rapidly bred), literally or figuratively
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
properly, to toss violently and suddenly (the sea with waves, the skin with boils); figuratively (in a favorable manner) to settle, i.e. quiet; specifically, to wink (from the motion of the eye-lids)

6.brief: a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
to be (causatively, make) light, literally (swift, small, sharp, etc.) or figuratively (easy, trifling, vile, etc.)
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a weaving; a braid; also a shuttle
to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
cessation, i.e. an end (especially of the earth); often used adverb, no further; also the ankle (in the dual), as being the extremity of the leg or foot
literally a cord (as an attachment); figuratively, expectancy

7.brief: properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)

8.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to spy out, i.e. (generally) survey, (for evil) lurk for, (for good) care for
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
sight, whether abstractly (vision) or concretely (a spectacle)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle

9.brief: to end, whether intransitive (to cease, be finished, perish) or transitived (to complete, prepare, consume)
a cloud (as covering the sky), i.e. the nimbus or thunder-cloud
to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative

10.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

11.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to restrain or (reflex.) refrain; by implication, to refuse, spare, preserve; to observe
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble ; (transitive) an opponent (as crowding)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to ponder, i.e. (by implication) converse (with oneself, and hence, aloud) or (transitively) utter
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

12.brief: a sea (as breaking in noisy surf) or large body of water; specifically (with the article), the Mediterranean Sea; sometimes a large river, or an artifical basin; locally, the west, or (rarely) the south
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
a marine or land monster, i.e. sea-serpent or jackal
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a guard (the man, the post or the prison); a deposit (figuratively); also (as observed) a usage (abstractly), or an example (concretely)

13.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself)
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
a contemplation; by implication, an utterance
a bed (figuratively, a bier); abstractly, sleep; by euphemism, carnal intercourse

14.brief: properly, to prostrate; hence, to break down, either (literally) by violence, or (figuratively) by confusion and fear

15.brief: properly, to try, i.e. (by implication) select
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
death (natural or violent); concretely, the dead, their place or state (hades); figuratively, pestilence, ruin
a bone (as strong); by extension, the body; figuratively, the substance, i.e. (as pron.) selfsame

16.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive
properly, to be flabby, i.e. (by implication) desist; (figuratively) be lacking or idle
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

17.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
a man in general (singly or collectively)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to be (causatively make) large (in various senses, as in body, mind, estate or honor, also in pride)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to place (in a very wide application)
near, with or among; often in general, to
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

18.brief: to visit (with friendly or hostile intent); by analogy, to oversee, muster, charge, care for, miss, deposit, etc.
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time
to test (especially metals); generally and figuratively, to investigate

19.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to gaze at or about (properly, for help); by implication, to inspect, consider, compassionate, be nonplussed (as looking around in amazement) or bewildered
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to slacken (in many applications, literal or figurative)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy

20.brief: properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
to guard, in a good sense (to protect, maintain, obey, etc.) or a bad one (to conceal, etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to put (used in a great variety of applications, literal, figurative, inferentially, and elliptically)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a burden; specifically, tribute, or (abstractly) porterage; figuratively, an utterance, chiefly adoom, especially singing; mental, desire

21.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
at this time, whether adverb, conjunction or expletive
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud
to lie down (for rest, sexual connection, decease or any other purpose)
properly, to dawn, i.e. (figuratively) be (up) early at any task (with the implication of earnestness); by extension, to search for (with painstaking)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
